private_information: I currently hold the eight disks in this order from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
Disk A is the smallest and disk H is the largest.
left_peg.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration where the right peg holds all disks A through H from top to bottom.

middle_peg.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration where the right peg holds all disks A through H from top to bottom.

right_peg.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration where the right peg holds all disks A through H from top to bottom.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance moving all disks from left to right under the standard rules.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are eight disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H from smallest (A) to largest (H).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
You may never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H from top to bottom; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg should have disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H from top to bottom; left and middle pegs should be empty.

describe.system_prompt: You are an observer for the left peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Describe your local state precisely, listing disks from top to bottom and any constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a concise machine-readable description of your peg's contents and any local constraints relevant to moving disks.

Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->left_peg->private_information} to produce a concise description of the left peg state and any local constraints to help the orchestrator reach the global goal {agents->left_peg->goal}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning. Your task is to integrate the local descriptions from the peg observers and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner to solve the Tower of Hanoi instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure actions are clearly named and that the problem encodes the initial and goal configurations and the constraint that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Target the FastDownwards solver in your PDDL style and requirements.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive concise descriptions of each peg from the agents: {left_description}, {middle_description}, and {right_description}. Using these descriptions and the public information {environment->public_information}, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that solves the global goal {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Keep peg-specific actions distinct where relevant and ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
